授業目的: The course is designed to provide an overview of how to develop research papers, theses, and dissertations.  The process of academic research paper development is simulated in the class. As part of your IBA program, you are required to develop a research paper (thesis). Most of your research may not be theory-building or theory-testing. But you still need to raise a fundamental question (or questions) that not only you but also readers (customers) of your research work would like to know more about. You will experience the process of research development and writing.
到達目標: You are expected to present and submit a research paper at the end of the semester.  The paper must focus on a contemporary research issue of your choice.  It may be an exhaustive literature review of a certain research area, a theory-building paper, an empirical theory-testing research (should the data be available), or a historical research.  This exercise aims to enhance your research skills through critical thinking and experience the development of a scholarly research paper. Although you may not pursue a research career after graduation, you should aim high and consider that the ultimate goal for the quality of your paper is at least its presentability in a national conference or preferably its publishability in a reputable academic journal.  Yes, my expectations are high.
授業方法: This course is an online seminar, and as such, each participant should come fully prepared to the class to participate in class discussion. I will take the role of a moderator with limited involvement as well as an advisor for your research development. While I will present an overview of the evolution of research streams, you will share the progress of your research and encourage the class discussion for further development of your research project.
